content.description: Start to the right of Stem City. Climb past the tree aiming for the short chimney with a chockstone forming a small roof. Pass the chockstone roof on the right.
content.protection: Standard rack. A #3 Camalot is useful, and you can sling the chockstone.

content.description: Straightforward climb following the chimney to the roof.  Fun smears on this climb and good pro
content.protection: Standard Rack - The route might wander depending on how you do it, so bring some longer slings
content.location: Start of Dragon area.  Climb up the obvious large chimney/gulley to the roof...or you can bail on a 5.6 out of a notch.  Good cracks for anchors.

content.description: Start to the right of the Wall of Kaza Dum. Climb the face heading for the steep left facing corner at the top of the cliff. Continue up the corner and pull directly through the overhang, or find a slightly easier traverse to the side.

Start directly below the dragon's crack and climb up to where the crack begins.  There is a a good place to stand and rest if needed before the crack.  Once on the crack, it is great climbing for 40 feet with plenty of holds and tons of solid pro.
content.protection: Tons of placements Standard Rack.  Hexes are useful
content.location: The Dragon's Crack is the left of the 3 cracks on the right side of LSM

content.description: There are two start options. First, start with Dragon's Back. Second, more sporty, head to the right of the bulge at the ground and boulder out a 5.9 start. Protection may be poor without some tricks. Head up the buttress to the thin triple cracks to the right of the Dragon's Back crack. Most people use some combination of all three cracks to get up.

This is a great area that has the most "committing" routes at LSM in my opinion because of their 40 ft vertical rock sections.   

  This spot is great for easy cracks and solid 5.7-5.8 climbing.
